div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, June 2, 1941
div1.opener:
June 2, 1941
Mr. P. M. Hamer, Chief
Division of Reference
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Hamer:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciate your letters of May
21 and 24. I am enclosing a check for $12.35 for which please send
me the material listed in your letter of May 21, namely:

row.cell:
1. Negative photostat of the material on
Walter Reed and the Columbia Barracks,

2. An 8 x 10 print of Walter Reed's oath
of office and a letter recommending the
appointment of a board,

3. A photograph of the endorsement on the
back of the latter,

4. Microfilms of certain material selected
by me,

5. Microfilm of the entire Medical History
of Camp Columbia,

div1.p:
In your letter of May 24, you told me about certain material
found among the records of the Adjutant General's office and the office
of the Secretary of War. Could you be a little more specific? To whom
could I write in each of these places to learn about such material?
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
